alert.note: Alert for Bartholomew (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 7:35PM EST until March 09 at 5:03AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana... Eel River. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following waterways in Indiana... Mill Creek, Flatrock River, Driftwood River, East Fork White River, East Fork White River, Big Blue River. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Moderate flooding in the Seymour area on the East Fork White River is expected to persist into Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Flatrock River near Columbus. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, On April 6, 2011 after reaching 13 feet... Noblitt Park...CR 400N and Owens Bend Park remained flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:30 PM EST Tuesday was 12.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.2 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 1200 AM EST.
